wikitext.*:
'''''The Ivy Bush: A Tolkien Magazine''''' is a [[Tolkien fandom|Tolkien fan]] magazine founded by Benita Prins and Rachel VanderWoude. It was published online from 2012 to 2018.

The magazine featured two articles per issue covering all aspects of Tolkien's work, including but not limited to [[Middle-earth]]. Each issue also contained features such as a language corner, original poetry, short stories, and trivia about the books and the films. The magazine tended towards a book purist bias.


==History==
''The Ivy Bush'' was published monthly from August 2012 until July 2015, when it was cut back to one issue every two months. ''The Ivy Bush'' eventually stopped publishing in 2018 with the November/December issue as its final issue. Every published issue is still available [https://issuu.com/theivybush online].
